name: 宋立垚
objective:
1. Introduce students to social works research methods
2. Understand science and its relationship to social issues
3. Familiarization with thesis writing and reporting issues in professional majors
4. Improvement of students' academic writing skills, especially those concerned with effective collection, communication, and presentation of information and rational arguments
schedule:
W1  Course Introduction
W2  Preparation of Doing Research
W3  What is research?
W4  Research Paper Writing and Publishing
W5  Thesis Writing
W6  Plagiarism
W7  Styles of Writing
W8  Thesis Proposal
W9  Mid-term Report
W10  Data Collection
W11  How to find Information
W12  Qualitative and Quantitative Research Methods
W13  Literature Review
W14  Observation Methods
W15  Interview Methods
W16  Questionnaire Methods
W17  Sampling
W18  Final Report
scorePolicy:
The final grade is based on 100 total points:
40 points for home assignments
20 points for the midterm (or paper)
20 for the final exam(or paper)
10 for Class Attendance
10 for Class Performance (include Discussions or Contributions to the class)
materials: Because this is a master course, a substantial part of the course requirements will be given by written or oral from the instructor. The format of the course will be mixture of lecture and discussion, writing, and field operations.
